meanings.definition: The state of being empty or unoccupied.
meanings.sent1: The vacantness of the room made it feel lonely.
meanings.sent2: The vacantness of the parking lot indicated it was closed.
meanings.sent3: The vacantness of the fridge was a mystery - where did all the food go?
meanings.sent4: Her eyes held a vacantness that hinted at deep sorrow.
meanings.sent5: The vacantness of the desert stretched endlessly under the scorching sun.

meanings.definition: The quality of lacking content or substance.
meanings.sent1: The vacantness of his promises left her feeling disappointed.
meanings.sent2: The vacantness of the book made it hard to stay interested.
meanings.sent3: The vacantness of the excuse was so obvious, it was almost comical.
meanings.sent4: His speech was filled with vacantness, devoid of any real meaning.
meanings.sent5: The vacantness of the painting made it hard to appreciate its beauty.
